Almandralejo Spain 38° 40′ 59″ N, 6° 24′ 33″ W 1847 found 'folded in half'
15350
silver
platter 0
2 decorative zones. Upper zone of 3 emps., presumably Theodosius flanked by (probably) Valentinian II & Arcadius. 4 columned facade behind. Inscr. next to rim ‘DN THEODOSIVS PERPET AVG OB DIEM FELICISSIMVM X’ (referring to Th.’s decennalia on Jan. 388). On underside ‘POÇ LI N MET’ (50 Roman lbs.).
388
Roman 740
<d._(f'ring)>260</d._(f'ring)> 34 <h_(f'ring)>22</h_(f'ring)> <h_(exc._f'ring)></h_(exc._f'ring)> 0
15350 46
Real Academia de la Historia, Madrid
Toynbee & Painter 1986, no. 16

Asia Minor Turkey
unknown
0
silver
bowl 0
Hemispherical with hunting scene decorative frieze. Description by Feugere translates as: 'A man in a tunic, wearing boots, faces a lion with his spear coming from his left, the animal leaps towards him, claws out, below, three rocks (?) and a tree (palm?) in the background. On both sides of the man's head, an inscription 'KOY/PHC. A palm (?) separates this scene from another similar, on which we see a bear over a mass of rocks, chased by a large dog.
300 400 Roman 102
<d._(f'ring)></d._(f'ring)> 65 <h_(f'ring)></h_(f'ring)> <h_(exc._f'ring)></h_(exc._f'ring)>
?
private collection

Scipio's Shield' France 43° 57′ 0″ N, 4° 48′ 36″ E 1656 found “in the Rhône near Avignon” (Toynbee & Painter)
10300 aka 'Scipio's shield' silver
platter 0
Low footring, rivets used to repair a tear. Traces of gilding. Central scene of Achilles, with Patroclus leading Briseis from Achilles tent. Achilles consults with Odysseus, scattered weapons at bottom, border of pomegranates.
300 400 Roman 710

Baku Russia
1800-1900 found “by chance” (Toynbee & Painter 1986)
silver gilding
plate
Partly gilded, with footring. Relief scenes of nereid on the back of a hippocamp, lead by a triton. Various other marine motifs.

The Carthage Treasure Tunisia 36° 51′ 10.08″ N, 10° 19′ 23.88″ E 1800-1900 Little is known about the circumstances of discovery, but Franks notes suggest that it was discovered next to the Church of St Louis.
silver
bowl 0
With flange, decorated with pastoral scenes, another pastoral scene in base of bowl

Castelvint Italy 46° 8′ 25″ N, 12° 13′ 0″ E 1937
silver gilding
Plate 0
With traces of gilding, beaded rim. Relief scene in three zones. Main scene shows Athens & Tiresias. Dotted insc. underneath possibly to be interpreted as p (ondera) II (duo) uncia or obolos tres duella sextula

Červenbreg Bulgaria 42° 18′ 0″ N, 23° 10′ 0.12″ E 1952
silver
Dish?
vertical, fluted rim. Central stamped medallion, with portrait of Licinius and inscrip. relating to his decennelia ‘LICINIVS INVICT AVG OB DIEM X SVORVM’. Pointillé inscr. on back ‘O FLAV NICANI MBN’ (last 2 ‘N’s reversed). Graffiti on back ‘Pro Gerontus’.

Cesena Italy 44° 13′ 21″ N, 12° 2′ 27″ E 1948 “found during building work in via Cimitero, with a second dish....the dishes were on top of the other, with their decorated faces opposed to each other”.
silver gilding; niello
platter 0
gilt with niello. Shallow footring. Part of the wall and approx. 80cm of the rim are missing (since restored). (Toynbee & Painter 1986). Rim deco’: Eight busts orig., + pastoral & hunting scenes. Central medallion showing a banquet. Two stamps on reverse, ‘PL’ or ‘LP’, & ivy leaf. Other may read ‘ANT’ or ‘ANL’
300 400 Roman 630

Conçesti Romania 48° 10′ 0″ N, 26° 33′ 0″ E 1812 “Part of a rich deposit of grave goods in a senior barbarian army officer’s grave.” (Toynbee & Painter, 1986)
silver gilding; niello
platter
gilt, nielloed. large no. of cracks, two major portions missing (rim & body). Frieze around rim, alternating centaur hunts, animal hunts with riders, and animal scenes. Central geometric medallion, 8 pointed star formed of interlocking squares; guilloche, and there are small animal and plant motifs inside the scroll.

silver
platter

Geneva Switzerland 46° 12′ 0″ N, 6° 9′ 0″ E 1721 found in a field on the banks of the Arve.
silver
plate
Very worn figured scene of an emperor (Valentinian I or II) flanked by six soldiers. Inscribed on upper border ‘LARGITAS DN VALENTINIANI AVGVSTI’.

The Kaiseraugst Treasure Switzerland 47° 33′ 0″ N, 7° 44′ 0″ E 1961-2 Found in the late Roman legionary fortress during excavations near to the south wall. Some items were thrown up by a bulldozer, others were recovered directly from disturbed Roman levels. 1, 2
silver gilding; niello
platter 0
Central medallion and inscription naming Constans. The inscription reads ‘AVGVSTVS CONSTANS DAT LAETA DECENNIA VICTOR SPONDENS OMNIBVS TER TRICENNALIA FAVSTIS’. The outer rim has ten portrait busts of uncertain characters (not thought to be mythological, or related to the House of Constantine), and complex niello and gilt geometric interlocking motifs
342 343 Roman 558

The Kaiseraugst Treasure Switzerland 47° 33′ 0″ N, 7° 44′ 0″ E 1961-2 Found in the late Roman legionary fortress during excavations near to the south wall. Some items were thrown up by a bulldozer, others were recovered directly from disturbed Roman levels. 1, 2
silver
platter 0
Eight sided, elaborate figurative frieze around rim. Nine scenes from life of Achilles. Pointillé inscr. underneath ‘ΠΑϒCϒΛϒΠΟϒ ΘΕCCΑΟΝΚΗC ΛΙΕ’ Graffiti in Greek

Kerch Crimea 5° 21′ 43″ N, 36° 28′ 16″ E 1891 This and the one below were found in a grave in Hospital St. Other objects beside these two vessels included 'a silver spoon a silver, or more probably gold crown, a silver dish, a buckle, and an amber ball' (T&P 1986, 25).
silver
dish 0
Probably with a footring, though this is no longer present. The vessel shows the triumphal entry of the emperor (probably Constantius II) on horseback riding r.; he is followed by a soldier, whilst Nike is in front of the horse but turns back.
337 361 Roman 249

Kostolac/Viminacium II Serbia 44° 43′ 0″ N, 21° 10′ 0″ E
silver
bowl 0
With flanged rim. In centre of the base is a female bust facing left; on the flanged rim are 4 Bacchic masks, between which are animal hunt scenes: a lion is pursuing a ?stag, a ?bear a ?horse, a ?bear a deer and a ?female lion a ?stag.

The 'Munich' Treasure Unprovenanced
c1972
silver
bowl
Licinius I, central medallion stamp and inscription ‘LICINIVS AVG OB D V LICINI FILI’ (Licinius ob diem quinquennaliroum Lininii, filii sui - the emperor Licinius on the occasion of the celebration of five years rule by his son Licinius). Nicomedia stamp ‘NIKO/AID/A; (Workshop 1 of the mint at Nicomedia in Bithynia, under the control of Aidesios).
321 322 Roman 179
<d._(f'ring)></d._(f'ring)> ? <h_(f'ring)></h_(f'ring)> <h_(exc._f'ring)></h_(exc._f'ring)>
